{{cpp/experimental/title|memory_alignment}}
{{cpp/experimental/simd/navbar}}

{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header | experimental/simd}}
{{dcl | since=parallelism_ts_2 | 1=
template&lt; class T, class U = typename T::value_type &gt;
struct memory_alignment;
}}
{{dcl end}}

If {{tt|is_simd_mask_v&lt;T&gt;}} is {{tt|true}} and {{tt|U}} is {{tt|bool}}, or if {{tt|is_simd_v&lt;T&gt;}} is {{tt|true}} and {{tt|U}} is a vectorizable type, provides the member constant {{tt|value}} equal to the minimum alignment of a pointer passed to a load constructor, {{tt|copy_from}} function, or {{tt|copy_to}} function. For any other types {{tt|T}} and {{tt|U}}, there is no member {{tt|value}}. 

{{cpp/types/nospec|v}}

===Helper variable template===
{{ddcl|since=parallelism_ts_2|1=
template&lt; class T, class U = typename T::value_type &gt;
constexpr std::size_t memory_alignment_v = memory_alignment&lt;T, U&gt;::value;
}}

{{cpp/types/integral_constant/inherit2|the minimum alignment of a pointer passed to a load constructor, {{tt|copy_from}} function, or {{tt|copy_to}} function|std::size_t}}
